= Database Configuration

This config section convert environment variable related to database configuration to valid odoo CLI.

include::partial$converters/database.adoc[]


[[option_db_name]]
== db_name
specify the database name

TIP: Supported Odoo version from 12.0 until 19.0

The environment variable `DB_NAME` is used and expect a xref:ROOT:type_var.adoc#env_var_value_type_str[str].

Odoo cli used:

* -d
* --database

[[option_db_host]]
== db_host
specify the database host

TIP: Supported Odoo version from 12.0 until 19.0

The environment variable `DB_HOST` is used and expect a xref:ROOT:type_var.adoc#env_var_value_type_str[str].

Odoo cli used:

* --db_host

[[option_db_port]]
== db_port
specify the database port

TIP: Supported Odoo version from 12.0 until 19.0

The environment variable `DB_PORT` is used and expect a xref:ROOT:type_var.adoc#env_var_value_type_int[int].

Odoo cli used:

* --db_port

[[option_db_user]]
== db_user
specify the database user name

TIP: Supported Odoo version from 12.0 until 19.0

The environment variable `DB_USER` is used and expect a xref:ROOT:type_var.adoc#env_var_value_type_str[str].

Odoo cli used:

* -r
* --db_user

[[option_db_password]]
== db_password
specify the database password

TIP: Supported Odoo version from 12.0 until 19.0

The environment variable `DB_PASSWORD` is used and expect a xref:ROOT:type_var.adoc#env_var_value_type_str[str].

Odoo cli used:

* -w
* --db_password

[[option_db_app_name]]
== db_app_name
specify the application name in the database, `\{pid}` is substituted by the process pid

TIP: Only Odoo version 19.0 is supported

The environment variable `DB_APP_NAME` is used and expect a xref:ROOT:type_var.adoc#env_var_value_type_str[str].

Odoo cli used:

* --db_app_name

[[option_db_maxconn]]
== db_maxconn
specify the maximum number of physical connections to PostgreSQL

TIP: Supported Odoo version from 12.0 until 19.0

The environment variable `DB_MAX_CONN` is used and expect a xref:ROOT:type_var.adoc#env_var_value_type_int[int].

Odoo cli used:

* --db_maxconn

[[option_db_replica_host]]
== db_replica_host
specify the replica host. Specify an empty db_replica_host to use the default unix socket.

TIP: Supported Odoo version from 18.0 until 19.0

The environment variable `DB_REPLICA_HOST` is used and expect a xref:ROOT:type_var.adoc#env_var_value_type_str[str].

Odoo cli used:

* --db_replica_host

[[option_db_replica_port]]
== db_replica_port
specify the replica port

TIP: Supported Odoo version from 18.0 until 19.0

The environment variable `DB_REPLICA_PORT` is used and expect a xref:ROOT:type_var.adoc#env_var_value_type_int[int].

Odoo cli used:

* --db_replica_port

[[option_db_template]]
== db_template
specify a custom database template to create a new database

TIP: Supported Odoo version from 12.0 until 19.0

The environment variable `DB_TEMPLATE` is used and expect a xref:ROOT:type_var.adoc#env_var_value_type_str[str].

Odoo cli used:

* --db-template

[[option_db_sslmode]]
== db_sslmode
NOTE: specify the database ssl connection mode (see PostgreSQL documentation)

Odoo cli used:

* --db_sslmode

The environment variable `DB_SSL_MODE` is used and expect a `str`.
Odoo cli used:

* --db_sslmode
Possible value are:

* disable
* allow
* prefer
* require
* verify-ca
* verify-full

[[option_list_db]]
== list_db
Disable the ability to obtain or view the list of databases.
        Also disable access to the database manager and selector,
        so be sure to set a proper --database parameter first

TIP: Supported Odoo version from 12.0 until 19.0

The environment variable `LIST_DB` is used and expect a xref:ROOT:type_var.adoc#env_var_value_type_bool[bool].

Odoo cli used:

* --no-database-list

[[option_dbfilter]]
== dbfilter
Regular expressions for filtering available databases for Web UI.
        The expression can use %d (domain) and %h (host) placeholders.

TIP: Supported Odoo version from 12.0 until 19.0

The environment variable `DB_FILTER` is used and expect a xref:ROOT:type_var.adoc#env_var_value_type_str[str].

Odoo cli used:

* --db-filter



== Only CLI args


=== specify the pg executable path
